column2: quid multiplicātī sunt quī trībulant mē? Multī insurgunt adversum mē. ^ Why
column4: are they multiplied that afflict me? many are they who rise up against me.

column1: 3 ^ Multī dīcunt animae meae: Nōn est salūs ipsī in Deō ejus. ^ Many say to my soul: There is no salvation for him in his God.

column5: et exaltans caput meum. ^ But thou
column9: and the lifter up of my head.

column2: et exaudīvit mē dē monte sānctō suō. ^ I have cried to the Lord with my voice
column3: and he hath heard me from his holy hill.
quia Dominus suscēpit mē. ^ I have slept and have taken my rest
column5: because the Lord hath protected me.

column1: 7 ^ Nōn timēbō millia populī circumdantīs mē. Exsurge Domine; salvum mē fac Deus meus. ^ I will not fear thousands of the people surrounding me. Arise

8 ^ Quoniam tū percussistī omnēs adversantēs mihi sine causā; dentēs peccātōrum contrīvistī. ^ For thou hast struck all them who are my adversaries without cause; thou hast broken the teeth of sinners.

column2: et super populum tuum benedictiō tua. ^ Salvation is of the Lord
column3: and thy blessing is upon thy people.
